meanings.definition: To feel deep sorrow or distress.
meanings.sent1: She grieves for her lost pet every day.
meanings.sent2: It is normal to grieve when a loved one passes away.
meanings.sent3: The cat grieved over the empty food bowl, meowing sadly.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to grieve the sun's absence.
meanings.sent5: The old tree seemed to grieve as its leaves fell in autumn.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel sorrow or distress.
meanings.sent1: His sudden departure grieved his family deeply.
meanings.sent2: The news of the accident grieved everyone in the community.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy grieved the cat by stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words seemed to grieve her fragile heart.
meanings.sent5: The loss of the championship grieved the entire team.
